title: The Phantom of the Opera at the Royal Albert Hall

Sir Cameron Mackintosh said ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œIt is amazing to think that the extraordinary success of The Phantom of the Opera is about to celebrate 25 years.

From the very first performance, audiences have fallen in love with the unique alchemy of Andrew Lloyd WebberÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s gorgeous score and Maria BjÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¶rnsonÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s fabulously beautiful design, so brilliantly staged by Hal Prince and Gillian Lynne.

The success of the show has become the stuff of theatrical legend so Andrew and I felt we  needed to create a really special performance to celebrate the 25th anniversary.

One of the great strengths of The Phantom of the Opera is that being set in an opera house, its production is totally theatrical. So we felt that there could be no better 19th Century theatrical auditorium in London for this occasion than the Royal Albert Hall. With its Victorian red plush and celebrated magnificent organ it is the perfect place for The Phantom to haunt. Though this special staging will naturally be drawn from the brilliant original, it will be both a spectacular and unique production with a cast and orchestra of over 200 headed by Ramin Karimloo and Sierra Boggess. Both artists have been an outstanding ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‹Å“PhantomÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ and ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‹Å“ChristineÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ in recent productions and have also enjoyed huge success together as the stars of Love Never Dies.

I have no doubt that these three performances at the Royal Albert Hall will be a thrilling celebration of the Music of the Night.ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½

THE PHANTOM OF THE OPERA became the longest running show in Broadway history on 9 January 2006 when it celebrated its 7,486th performance, surpassing the previous record holder ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œCatsÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½. This coincided with the Broadway and the US national touring company celebrating an unprecedented 20,000 performances in the United States. In October 2010 the London production celebrated its 10,000th performance.

THE PHANTOM OF THE OPERA has won over 50 major theatre awards, including seven Tonys on Broadway and three Olivier Awards in the West End. It won the ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‹Å“Most Popular Musical Audience AwardÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢, voted by the public, in the 2002 Laurence Olivier Awards. THE PHANTOM OF THE OPERA, which opened at Her MajestyÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s Theatre on 9 October 1986 starred Michael Crawford as ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‹Å“The PhantomÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ and Sarah Brightman as ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‹Å“Christine.ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ It is produced by Cameron Mackintosh and The Really Useful Theatre Company Limited.

Worldwide, THE PHANTOM OF THE OPERA has grossed over Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â£3.2 billion. The box office revenues are higher than any film or stage play in history, including ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œTitanicÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½, ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œETÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ and ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œStar WarsÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½. It has been seen in 145 cities in 27 countries and played to over 100 million people. THE PHANTOM OF THE OPERA is currently showing in London, New York, Budapest, Las Vegas, and Kyoto.
